sanskrit_verse:
धर्मेणाधिगतो यैस्तु वेदः सपरिबृंहणः ।
ते शिष्टा ब्राह्मणा ज्ञेयाः श्रुतिप्रत्यक्षहेतवः ॥ १२.१०९॥
transliteration:
dharmeṇādhigato yais tu vedaḥ saparibṛṃhaṇaḥ |
te śiṣṭā brāhmaṇā jñeyāḥ śrutipratyakṣahetavaḥ || 12.109||
sph_interpretive_translation: Those who have realized the Veda expanded by Dharma are known as the instructed Brahmanas, whose authority arises directly from Shruti and Pratyaksha.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derived solely from direct realization of Shruti
Capacity-based responsibility defined by spiritual attainment
Restoration through alignment with realized truth
Consciousness alignment as the basis of legal validity
executable_legal_axioms: IF a being has attained Shruti-pratyaksha realization AND demonstrated Dharma-aligned conduct THEN grant authoritative status
IF a case involves metaphysical or scriptural interpretation THEN defer to those with verified Shruti-pratyaksha pramana
IF capacity for realization is obstructed THEN initiate restoration protocols to remove barriers
IF an individual rejects realized truth without valid cognition THEN disqualify from authoritative decision-making roles
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, only those jurists who demonstrate Shruti-pratyaksha realization and live accordance with Dharma may interpret constitutional matters involving ultimate truths. The threshold of responsibility lies not in institutional position but in realized capacity. Authority flows from consciousness, not appointment.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana-based causality establishes that realization of Shruti grants legitimate authority. Anupurvasah shows that such realization naturally leads to right action. Responsibility follows capacity; no punitive overlay is required because misalignment dissolves upon recognition of truth. Truth itself restores order.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate pratyaksha-shruti alignment process for disqualified authorities
Provide access to Vedic study under realized teachers for capacity expansion
Reintegrate dissenters through guided realization rather than exclusion
Establish regular verification of continued alignment with Dharma among ruling authorities
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of all Dharma. This law originates from realized consciousness, operates through restoration, and concludes in universal alignment. There is no punishment—only the inevitable unfolding of truth-consciousness.
